items.question: The shift from rational comprehensive planning to communicative planning theory reflects:
options: B) Fundamental epistemological transformation from positivist to post-positivist paradigms

options: B) Legitimacy through undistorted dialogue among all affected parties

items.question: The paradox of planning in neoliberal contexts manifests as:
options: B) Market-oriented planning that undermines public interest while claiming efficiency

options: B) Exposing Western-centric assumptions and advocating indigenous knowledge systems

items.question: The concept of insurgent planning recognizes:
options: B) Counter-hegemonic practices by marginalized communities outside formal systems

options: B) Cities as dynamic assemblages of heterogeneous components with emergent properties

items.question: The ontological turn in planning theory challenges:

options: B) Recognition of non-linear dynamics and limits of prediction

items.question: The concept of planning as performative practice means:
options: B) Planning discourse constitutes the reality it purports to describe

options: B) Stratified ontology recognizing structures, mechanisms, and events
